articles.title: High-level EU delegation to visit DPRK
articles.content:
High-level EU delegation to visit DPRK 
    Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- A high-level delegation of the European Union led by Joran Persson, President of the European Council and Prime Minister of Sweden, Javier Solana, high representative for common foreign and security policy of the EU, and Chris Patten, commissioner for external relations of the European commission, will shortly visit the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.

articles.title: S. Korean police assailed by Hanchongryon
articles.content:
S. Korean police assailed by Hanchongryon 
    Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- The South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) on April 23 issued a statement as regards South Korean police's walking away Pae Min Gyun,  chairman of the general student council of Konkuk University, according to a news report.
 The statement said that the police action is aimed to bar the Hanchongryon's struggle to check the increase of registration fee and secure educational finance from enlisting support from broad segments of people and gaining in scope and strength.   
 The statement branded the police's illegal arrest of a deputy to Hanchongryon for the mere reason that he is a member of the "enemy-benefitting organization" as an intolerable anti-reunification action and demanded the police authorities release Pae at once and punish those responsible for it and make an official apology for it.

DPRK paddlers prove successful
articles.content:
DPRK paddlers prove successful 
    Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Paddlers of the DPRK placed second in the women's team event at the 46th World Table-Tennis Championship which is being held in Osaka, Japan.
 They competed with the Chinese paddlers in the final after defeating the South Korean counterparts in the semi-finals.

Greetings to Queen of Netherlands
articles.content:
Greetings to Queen of Netherlands 
    Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings on April 27 to Queen Beatrix of the Kingdom of the Netherlands on the occasion of its national day.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in political, economic, cultural and other fields in the common interests of the two peoples.    
 It wished greater success to her in her work and health and happiness to her and her family.
